intro: Parasenecio lancifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved parasenecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Its narrow, lance-shaped leaves are arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially threatened species.
